title: First phase of third school term to begin today
byline: The first phase of the third term for the year 2025 for government and government-approved private schools will commence today (18), according to the Ministry of Education.

title: Zelensky and allies head to White House for Ukraine talks
byline: US President Donald Trump will host Volodymyr Zelensky on Monday for their first meeting since the pair’s heated exchange in the White House earlier this year - but this time the Ukrainian president is bringing European allies.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Oscar-nominated British actor Terence Stamp dies aged 87
byline: Terence Stamp, who made his name as an actor in 1960s London and went on to play the arch-villain General Zod in the Hollywood hits “Superman” and “Superman II”, has died aged 87, his family said on Sunday.

title: Govt urges calm as investigations continue into Mullaitivu incident
byline: Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa urged the people of the North and East to avoid being misled by false information and distortions aimed at undermining the government and the country’s security forces.

title: 46-year-old attacked to death over personal dispute
byline: A person has been attacked to death with a sharp weapon and clubs in the Dunagaha area of Divulapitiya.

title: Woman arrested in Dehiwala with narcotics pills worth over Rs. 500,000
byline: A woman has been arrested with a stock of narcotics valued at over Rs. 500,000 taken into custody by the Mount Lavinia Division Criminal Investigation Unit.

title: President’s Secretary says efficiency of public service can be enhanced through AI
byline: Another workshop in a series of special seminars planned for government executive officers on the use of artificial intelligence (AI) to turn the public service into an effective and efficient service was held at Temple Trees on Saturday (16).

title: More than 200 missing in flood-hit district in Pakistan, official says
byline: More than 200 people remain missing in one district of north-west Pakistan as a result of devastating monsoon flooding and landslides, an official has said.

title: Sri Lankan man arrested in Malaysia with narcotics
byline: A Sri Lanka national has been arrested for the possession of narcotics during a raid conducted in Bukit Tambun, Malaysia.

title: Trump-Putin talks produced enough movement to justify Ukraine meeting, Rubio says
byline: Talks between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian leader Vladimir Putin produced enough movement to justify a meeting with Ukrainian and European leaders, U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio told CBS on Sunday.

title: Mound of earth blocks Norton Bridge–Maskeliya main road
byline: Norton Bridge Police said that traffic movement on the Norton Bridge–Maskeliya main road has been completely halted due to a mound of earth collapsing onto the road.

title: Indonesia: 5.7-magnitude earthquake strikes Sulawesi, no serious damage
byline: A magnitude 5.7 earthquake struck Sulawesi, Indonesia, on Sunday, the German Research Centre for Geosciences reported.

title: Showers, strong winds expected in several areas of the country today
byline: Showers can be expected at times in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts today.

title: European leaders to join Ukraine’s Zelenskyy for White House meeting with Trump
byline: European and NATO leaders will join Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskyy for his crucial meeting with President Trump on Monday, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Sunday.

title: Publishers issue warning on AI-created books imitating sports autobiographies
byline: The publishing industry has warned that books created by artificial intelligence - often imitating autobiographies - are a growing concern, and called on retailers to issue clearer warnings to consumers.

title: Another 609 individuals nabbed during special island-wide police raids
byline: A total of 609 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday.

title: Tourist arrivals in August top 99,000
byline: A total of 99,406 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in August, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority shows.

title: Air Canada flights cancelled as strike begins
byline: The Canadian government has moved to end a strike by Air Canada’s cabin crews and require binding arbitration to break their contract impasse, an action that the country’s largest carrier had sought but unionized flight attendants fiercely opposed.

title: Sri Lanka’s service sector expands in July
byline: Sri Lanka’s services sector expanded in July, supported by growth in wholesale and retail trade, financial services, and the transportation of goods, according to the latest Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: ‘Galu Kumari’ Train Derailment: One railway track reopened for limited operations
byline: The Department of Railways states that restoration work is still underway on the ‘Galu Kumari’ express train, which derailed near the Ginthota Railway Station yesterday.

title: US-India trade talks scheduled for August called off, source says
byline: A planned visit by US trade negotiators to New Delhi from August 25-29 has been called off, a source said, delaying talks on a proposed trade agreement and dashing hopes of relief from additional US tariffs on Indian goods from August 27.

title: US halts visitor visas used for medical trips from Gaza
byline: The US State Department announced it was halting all visitor visas for people from Gaza.

title: Israel prepares to move Palestinians to southern Gaza as Israelis urge mass protest over war
byline: Israel announced Saturday that it is preparing to move Palestinians from combat zones to southern Gaza as plans move ahead for a military offensive in some of the territory’s most populated areas.

title: 7 killed after cloudburst, landslide in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kathua, rescue ops on
byline: At least seven people were killed and many others were injured in two separate incidents of cloudburst and landslide in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kathua district, officials said on Sunday.

title: Two dead, over 10 injured in fatal accident in Omanthai
byline: At least two persons have reportedly died and more than 10 others have sustained injuries in a fatal accident that occurred this evening (17) in the Omanthai area on the A-9 road, police said.

title: Pension scheme for fishermen to be reintroduced next month
byline: The Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board states that the fishermen’s pension scheme is expected to be reintroduced starting next month.

title: Deputy Minister of Defence visits USS Santa Barbara
byline: Deputy Minister of Defence Major General Aruna Jayasekara (Retd) visited the USS Santa Barbara (LCS), an Independence-class Littoral Combat Ship of the United States Navy, currently docked at the Port of Colombo, on Saturday (Aug 16).

title: More skilled jobs for Sri Lankans in Singapore?
byline: A discussion has been held in a bid to strengthen collaboration in labour-related matters, particularly to explore avenues to generate job opportunities for Sri Lankan nationals in Singapore in sectors such as hospitality, healthcare, and manufacturing.

title: Train services between Colombo and Beliatta still disrupted due to derailment
byline: The Department of Railways states that restoration work is still ongoing on the ‘Galu Kumari’ express train that derailed near the Ginthota Railway Station along the coastal railway line.

title: 53-year-old killed in wild elephant attack in Ambanpola
byline: An individual has died after being attacked by a wild elephant in the Ambanpola area.

title: Govt fully supports action taken against underworld figures: New IGP
byline: A more advanced strategy is now being implemented to suppress underworld crimes, replacing the existing approaches, according to Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya.

title: 37 females among 257 drowning deaths in 2025: Police
byline: A total of 257 persons have died due to drowning incidents so far this year, police said.

title: Erin strengthens to a Category 5 hurricane, NHC says
byline: Hurricane Erin, the first hurricane of the 2025 Atlantic season, has become a catastrophic Category 5 hurricane, the US National Hurricane Center said on Saturday.

title: ‘Hartal’ launched in North and East
byline: A ‘hartal’ is currently underway in the North and East, according to the Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK).

title: Postal workers’ strike continues island-wide as Minister urges to resume duties
byline: The strike action initiated by the Postal and Telecommunications Officers’ Union, together with the United Postal Trade Unions’ Front (UPTUF), will continue for the second consecutive day today (18).

title: More than 40 missing in Nigeria boat accident
byline: More than 40 people were missing in a boat accident in Nigeria after a boat conveying 50 persons to a popular market in northwest Sokoto State capsized on Sunday, the country’s emergency agency said.

title: Trains delayed on coastal and main lines after derailment
byline: A train traveling from Galle to Colombo derailed this morning (18) between Maradana and Colombo Fort railway stations, causing significant delays on both the main and coastal railway lines, according to Sri Lanka Railways.

title: Another 641 persons arrested in special island-wide police raids
byline: A total of 641 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday, the Police Media Division said.

title: Provincial Council Elections likely in first half of 2026 - Minister Bimal
byline: Minister Bimal Rathnayake revealed that constitutional reforms will be introduced following the conducting of the Provincial Council Elections.

title: Police recover three T-56 firearms abandoned on roadside in Kaduwela
byline: Police have recovered three T-56 firearms while abandoned on the roadside in Kaduwela, police stated.

title: CEB records over Rs. 5 bln profit in 2025 second quarter
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has reported a profit of Rs. 5.31 billion for the financial quarter ending on June 30, 2025.

title: Okkampitiya OIC’s bail application rejected
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has rejected the bail application filed by the Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Okkampitiya Police, who was arrested in connection with soliciting a bribe of Rs. 40,000 from a businessman.

title: Trump blocks Ukraine from joining NATO, orders Crimea to Russia ahead of talks with Zelensky
byline: US President Donald Trump said reclaiming Crimea or entering NATO were off the table for Ukraine, as President Volodymyr Zelensky arrived in Washington for Monday talks aimed at ending the war with Russia.

title: Apple reportedly developing new operating system for future smart devices
byline: Apple is reportedly working on a completely new operating system codenamed ‘Charismatic’.

title: Govt institutions, schools in North functioning as usual despite ‘hartal’ called by ITAK
byline: A ‘hartal’ called in the Northern and Eastern Provinces, demanding justice for the recent death of a 32-year-old man in Mullaitivu and based on several other demands, has reportedly been unsuccessful.

title: Man drowns while fishing in a lake in Sevanagala
byline: A 42-year-old man has tragically drowned and died in the Haburugala Bodhiraja Lake, in Sevanagala.

title: Coolie Box Office Collection: Rajinikanth’s film set to cross INR 2 billion in India
byline: Superstar Rajinikanth’s Coolie is roaring at the box office in India, according to latest figures.

title: Chief Incumbent of Mihintale Rajamaha Viharaya at CID to lodge complaints
byline: The Chief Incumbent of the Mihintale Rajamaha Viharaya, Ven Walawahengunawe Dhammarathana Thero, arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago.

title: Air Canada grounded as striking union defies order to get back to work
byline: Air Canada’s,  fleet of hundreds of planes remained grounded on Monday morning after striking flight attendants refused a government-backed order to get back to work and called on the airline to return to the bargaining table.

title: Ex-State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera, who was arrested and remanded for allegedly selling a plot of state-owned land in Kiribathgoda to a private party by forging documents, has been further remanded.

title: Tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka surpass 1.5 million in 2025
byline: The number of tourists who have arrived in Sri Lanka so far this year has exceeded the 1.5 million mark, according to Minister of Tourism Vijitha Herath.

title: Man arrested with firearm, diamond watch by Grandpass Police
byline: An individual has been arrested for the possession of a firearm by the Grandpass Police.

title: At least 20 killed, 134 people injured in blast at factory in Russia’s Ryazan region
byline: The death toll from an unexplained blast last week at a factory in Russia’s Ryazan region has jumped to at least 20, with another 134 people injured, emergency services said on Monday.

title: Rajitha Senaratne files motion requesting temporarily suspension of arrest warrant
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne has filed a motion before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, seeking a temporary suspension of the warrant issued for his arrest in connection with an investigation conducted by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Airports & Aviation Services company records 78% growth in operational profit in H1 2025
byline: The operational profit of the Airport & Aviation Services (Private) Limited has increased by 78% in the first six months of 2025 compared to the same period in the previous year.

title: US adviser Navarro says India’s Russian crude buying has to stop
byline: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said India’s purchases of Russian crude were funding Moscow’s war in Ukraine and had to stop, adding that New Delhi was “now cozying up to both Russia and China”.

title: Naked body found in paddy field in Badulla
byline: Police say the naked body of an elderly man who died under mysterious circumstances was found in a paddy field adjacent to the Kailagoda Elders’ Home in Badulla this morning (18).

title: Hartal called by ITAK a resounding success, Shanakiyan says
byline: The hartal called by the Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) in the Northern and Eastern Provinces, was a resounding success, according to Member of Parliament Shanakiyan Rasamanickam.

title: Arrest warrant issued for former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has issued a warrant for the arrest of Thusitha Halloluwa, the former Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Firearms found in roadside at Kaduwela are fake – Police confirm
byline: Police have stated that the firearms discovered inside a bag abandoned on the roadside in Thunadahena, Korathota, Kaduwela were not real guns.

title: Entry to BIA Departure Lobby restricted at peak hours on Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays
byline: Visitor entry tickets to the Departure Lobby of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) will not be issued during peak hours of Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays, the Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited has announced.

title: Chinese FM Wang Yi arrives in India to meet key leaders
byline: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi landed in New Delhi today for a two-day official visit.

title: Ada Derana report prompts Port City Economic Commission to take action against two APs
byline: The Colombo Port City Economic Commission has suspended the issuance of visa recommendations for two Authorised Persons, following a report published by Ada Derana on August 13 pertaining to the detention and deportation of five Chinese nationals employed by said APs.

title: Warrant issued for the arrest of ex-MP Athuraliye Rathana Thero
byline: A warrant has been issued for the arrest of former Member of Parliament Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thero.

title: Two more petitions filed challenging bill to revoke privileges of former Presidents
byline: Two more petitions have been filed before the Supreme Court challenging the bill presented in Parliament by the government to revoke the privileges of former Presidents, according to Ada Derana reporter.

title: ASPI closes at new all-time high today
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed at an all-time high after gaining over 252.16 points today. MORE

title: Spain, Portugal order mass evacuation of residents as wildfires rage
byline: Wildfires gripping Spain and Portugal forced mass evacuations and the deployment of thousands of emergency personnel as a heatwave continues to ravage the Iberian Peninsula, Euro News reported.

title: Strike will continue until demands are met – Postal Trade Unions
byline: Postal trade unions have declared that they will continue their strike until all their demands are fulfilled.

title: Sri Lanka’s food insecurity drops from 24% to 16% – World Food Programme
byline: Sri Lanka has reduced its food insecurity rate from 24% to 16%, according to Philip Ward, the newly appointed representative and the Country Director of the United Nations World Food Programme in Sri Lanka.

title: Trump tariffs won’t significantly reduce U.S. debts: U.S. economists
byline: US economists deem that hiking tariffs may slow the growth of U.S. debts but not achieve any significant reduction, said a report released by the Fortune magazine on its website on Sunday.

title: Court orders police to report on progress into Kotahena schoolgirl suicide incident
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court was informed today that police are continuing investigations into the alleged sexual abuse of a schoolgirl who died by suicide after jumping from a high-rise building in Kotahena, Colombo.

title: Complaint filed with Bribery Commission against Energy Minister
byline: A complaint has been filed with the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption against Minister of Energy Kumara Jayakody, alleging involvement in corrupt activities.

title: Hamas cites progress in ceasefire talks as Palestinian death toll passes 62,000
byline: Hamas said Monday it has accepted a new proposal from Arab mediators for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip that would still need Israel’s approval, as Gaza’s Health Ministry said the Palestinian death toll from 22 months of war has passed 62,000.

title: US launches inaugural Young South Asian Leaders Initiative workshop in Colombo
byline: U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung, Acting Deputy Assistant Secretary for South and Central Asian Affairs Shelly Seaver, and Minister of Youth Affairs and Sports Sunil Gamage opened the inaugural workshop of the Young South Asian Leaders Initiative (YSALI) in Colombo today (18).
